    <item>
      <title>A mild, cloudy and often wet night for the UK. </title>
      <description>Atlantic weather fronts spread cloudy, wet and mild conditions eastwards overnight and throughout tomorrow. </description>

    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Four killed in church shooting in Russian region of Dagestan</title>
      <description>The gunman killed four and wounded four others after opening fire on worshippers leaving a service in the southern Russian region.</description>
      <link>http://www.itv.com/news/2018-02-18/four-killed-in-church-shooting-in-russian-region-of-dagestan/</link>

    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Justine Greening vs Damian Hinds</title>
      <description>Has Damian Hinds' proposal that universities could perhaps charge different fees for different courses opened a can of worms, asks Peston?</description>

    <item>
      <title>Oxfam scandal has made defending UK aid budget harder, Ruth Davidson says</title>
      <description>Ruth Davidson said that international helpers who exploits the vulnerable for sex occupy "the lowest circle of Hell".</description>

    <item>
      <title>Education Minister: Tuition fees should reflect value to society</title>
      <description>Damian Hinds' suggested that fees should reflect the cost of delivering a course and future earnings, as well as the needs of the country.</description>

    </item>
    <item>
      <title>65 people killed as plane crashes in southern Iran</title>

      <title>190 British actresses demand end to sexual harassment ahead of Baftas</title>

      <title>Inmate jailed for manslaughter and previously for kidnap escapes from prison</title>
      <description>Police say that anyone who sees Whitehouse should not approach him, but instead call them on 999 and quote incident 23 of 18 February.</description>

      <title>Family of murdered MP Jo Cox pledge support to husband Brendan after 'inappropriate' behaviour </title>

      <title>Henry Bolton sacked as Ukip leader after party backs no confidence vote</title>
      <description>Henry Bolton has been dismissed as leader of Ukip after party members backed a no confidence motion at an extraordinary general meeting.</description>

      <title>Team GB's Lizzy Yarnold wins gold in skeleton as teammate Laura Deas takes bronze at Winter Olympics</title>

      <title>Winter Olympics: Team GB bags first skiing medal as Izzy Atkin wins bronze</title>

      <title>How Barry Bennell secured a 'passport' to abuse boys on US holidays</title>

      <title>Florida Governor Rick Scott calls on FBI director to resign over failure to probe school shooting tip-off</title>

      <title>Woman tells ITV News she began relationship with 'orgy-loving' Oxfam ex-Haiti chief Roland van Hauwermeiren at 17</title>
      <description>The Haitian told ITV News she was heavily pregnant when he saw her from an Oxfam car and said: "I find you very sexy, how can I help you?"</description>
      <link>http://www.itv.com/news/2018-02-16/woman-tells-itv-news-she-began-relationship-with-orgy-loving-oxfam-ex-haiti-chief-roland-van-hauwermeiren-at-17/</link>

    </item>

      <title>Angela Merkel 'not frustrated but curious' about what UK wants from Brexit</title>

      <title>Teenager sentenced for rape and attempted murder of woman in city park</title>
      <description>A teenage rapist who bludgeoned a woman with a paving slab and left her for dead in a Leicester park has been sentenced to life in custody. </description>

      <title>Climber's desperate 911 call to save man who plummeted 1,000 feet</title>
      <description>Braton Jurasevich braved falling ice blocks in a bid to help a fellow climber who had fallen 1,000 ft from Oregan's tallest peak.</description>

      <title>Why do fans of Japan figure skating champ Yuzuru Hanyu pelt him with Pooh Bears?</title>

    <item>
      <title>Whistleblower claims Russell Hume sold foreign beef as British</title>
